{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3253110,"name":"Eric Leavitt","username":"eleavitt","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/85e7bf/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-11-13T23:45:48.010Z","cooked":"

One of our Spark Max motor controllers has a Gate driver fault that we cannot seem to clear. When we try to use the driver station it keeps giving us an external HAL error. We noticed that the motor controllers before the bad one seemed to work fine and would drive, but the ones after it would not. In a previous thread in 2019 another team said they were having this Gate Driver Fault but I could not find the fix. It looked like they just took it to another team and they got it to work miraculously but the solution was not apparent. Any ideas?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":44,"updated_at":"2023-11-13T23:45:48.010Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":599,"reads":436,"readers_count":435,"score":3082.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":444231,"topic_slug":"gate-driver-fault","display_username":"Eric Leavitt","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48429,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/gate-driver-fault/444231/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3253118,"name":"Amicus1","username":"Amicus1","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a9adbd/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-11-14T00:06:50.099Z","cooked":"

The Gate Driver fault is generally a lack of 12v power to the controller, but could be an internal electronics issue. How is the controller powered when it has this fault? If the robot is off or the controller is not getting powered by 12v, and it’s just powered by the USB cable to the Rev Hardware Client, this is normal.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":44,"updated_at":"2023-11-14T00:06:50.099Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":425,"readers_count":424,"score":185.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":444231,"topic_slug":"gate-driver-fault","display_username":"Amicus1","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33946,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue"},"post_url":"/t/gate-driver-fault/444231/2","custom_user_title":"6995A/Choreo/Monologue","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3327750,"name":"Miles Fettinger","username":"mfettinger","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/f9ae1b/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T14:21:37.757Z","cooked":"

We have had this problem too. We spun in a circle our first match because of the gate driver fault suddenly occurred. We changed it out but had to borrow one to keep the bot rolling and now they are sold out. We have done a full reset and reloaded firmware twice and it seems like everything is OK but in a short time it randomly comes back. Is it salvagable or should we just let it go?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":44,"updated_at":"2024-03-08T14:21:37.757Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":80.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":444231,"topic_slug":"gate-driver-fault","display_username":"Miles Fettinger","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54168,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/gate-driver-fault/444231/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3327753,"name":"Josh Bodenstein","username":"JOOT49","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joot49/{size}/179153_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-08T14:24:36.231Z","cooked":"

If that happened randomly, there is likely a short somewhere inside the Spark MAX. Contact REV, and provide screenshots of the HW client and the behavior that it is showing on the field.

Or your present? They’re very fast normally and escalate problems quickly, it won’t help if you’re at a comp rn but maybe the day or 2 after you can get a new one?

Hey, Our Spark MAX Failed and is now Showing the Status code for Gate Driver Fault and is completely unresponsive to our CAN Bus and the Rev hardware client.

Spark MAX Rev Client Data

Current Version: 24.0.1
Latest Version: 24.0.1

Rev Client Device Faults

Name Active Fault Status Sticky Fault Status
Brownout OK OK
Over Current OK OK
Watchdog Reset OK OK
Motor Type Fault OK OK
Sensor Fault OK OK
Stall OK OK
EEPROM Fault OK OK
CAN TX Fault OK OK
CAN RX Fault OK OK
Has Reset OK Error Present
Gate Driver Fault Error Present Error Present
Other Fault OK OK
Soft Limit Forward Not at limit Not at limit
Soft Limit Reverse Not at limit Not at limit
Hard Limit Forward Not at limit Not at limit
Hard Limit Reverse Not at limit Not at limit

Spark MAX Settings

|Motor Type | Brushed
|Idle Mode | Brake
|Smart Current Limit | 80
|Sensor Type | Encoder
|Encoder Counts Per Rev | 4096
|PWM Input Deadband | 0.05
|Hard Forward Limit | Enabled
|Forward Limit Polarity | Normally Opened
|Hard Reverse Limit | Enabled
|Reverse Limit Polarity | Normally Open
|Forward Limit | Disabled
|Forward Limit Value | 0
|Ramp Rate | Disabled
|Rate (seconds to full speed) | 0

Seen Before the Fault - All 4 Neo’s Spinning, 4/4 Sparks are Happy and Responding.
Seen After the Fault - 3/4 Neo’s are spinning, 3/4 Sparks are Happy and Responding, 1/4 Sparks showing Gate Driver Fault.

Guess to why It failed - Originally we had a stuttering issue with our Neo’s and it was that our Green and Yellow Cables Were wired Green to Yellow and Yellow to Green we then fixed the wiring and the Stuttering went away and never reappeared. The other day our Spark started showing the Orange and Cyan Blink code.

Attempts to fix - Downgrade Spark SW Version (Failed), Complete Factory Reset (Failed), Power Cycle (Failed),

Init Code for Spark MAX’s

public Drivetrain() {
        m_leftMotor = new CANSparkMax(DrivetrainConstants.kLMotorFrontCanId, MotorType.kBrushless);
        m_leftMotor.setIdleMode(IdleMode.kBrake);
        m_leftMotor.burnFlash();

        m_leftMotorFollower = new CANSparkMax(DrivetrainConstants.kLMotorRearCanId, MotorType.kBrushless);
        m_leftMotorFollower.follow(m_leftMotor);
        m_leftMotorFollower.setIdleMode(IdleMode.kBrake);
        m_leftMotorFollower.burnFlash();

        m_rightMotor = new CANSparkMax(DrivetrainConstants.kRMotorFrontCanId, MotorType.kBrushless);
        m_rightMotor.setInverted(true);
        m_rightMotor.setIdleMode(IdleMode.kBrake);
        m_rightMotor.burnFlash();
        
        m_rightMotorFollower = new CANSparkMax(DrivetrainConstants.kRMotorRearCanId, MotorType.kBrushless);
        m_rightMotorFollower.follow(m_rightMotor);
        m_rightMotorFollower.setIdleMode(IdleMode.kBrake);
        m_rightMotorFollower.burnFlash();

        m_robotDrive = new DifferentialDrive(m_leftMotor, m_rightMotor);
}

Drive Code

 public Command teleopDrive(DoubleSupplier speed, DoubleSupplier rotation) {
        return run(() -> { // This is a Command factory that uses a lambda that you feed into your CommandXboxController
            double xSpeed = MathUtil.applyDeadband(speed.getAsDouble(), Constants.IOConstants.kDriverDeadband); // Deadband battles stick drift and
            double zRotation = MathUtil.applyDeadband(rotation.getAsDouble(), Constants.IOConstants.kDriverDeadband); // adds a area on your joystick that's "dead" or ignored
            m_robotDrive.arcadeDrive(-Constants.DrivetrainConstants.speedModifier*xSpeed, Constants.DrivetrainConstants.speedModifier*zRotation);
        });
    }

We have asked Several Local Teams about this and they don’t know anything about the Gate Driver Fault

Spark MAX Blink Code

Does anyone know how to fix this?

I believe if your running neos it should be brushless not brushed, that is a Definite problem if running neos, and could cause the spark max and or neo to go bad

Nvm I see your setting it in the code to brushless

We had this issue, but it was blatant what had happened as we powered it up wired backwards, and that fried the spark max but in your situation I am not sure what might have caused it unless it was wired backwards at some point or run on brushed mode at some point

I’m not sure what else to recommend my best guess at this point is a bad internal component to the spark max, how it happens not sure, my last best guess to try is factory reset it, reconfigure the firmware then plug it into a new channel on the pdp using a diffrent fuse and see if that does anything I don’t think it will but maybe the problem is stemming from that specific pdp channel

But you said other spark max work fine in oalce of that one so that tells me the channel is good,

It’s not impossible that the spark max went bad, with our you doing anything to cause it no product is perfect at preventing failures
